intro: Fumaria munbyi, commonly known as the Munby's smokeplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant produces delicate, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Fumaria munbyi is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
